data.title: Poor Service in a Fairly Empty Restaurant
data.text: The food was acceptable but not exceptiona,l and service was very slow. We had to ask about dessert (limited) & coffee. When we asked for cream for the latter, we were given packets of powdered creamer. Pressing the issue got us a small saucer of milk! Very strange...

data.title: Greasy, smelly......
data.text: Wow, how can you go wrong with chicken and vegetables....but oh yes, the place smells and way too much oil used...difficulty with getting order steamed.  OK, for a quick pick up.

data.title: NOT LIKE I REMEMBER IT....
data.text: I had almond chicken,egg drop soup and eggrolls.It all tasted the same to me bland and very unappealing.My buddy asked about the specials on the board.The waitress said to come up there and show her what he wanted.She said she wasnt familiar with the menu [very obvious}.She never brought us any tea.Maybe I was supposed to ask??Where the bar area used to be there was now chairs stacked in that room. The place was [shabby chic]but not in a good way.It wasnt like this 16 yrs.ago when i lived in Novi.Maybe its true when they say you "cant go home"I WONT BE BACK....

data.title: The Almond Chicken is like nowhere else.  Delicious.
data.text: Everytime I am in this part of Detroit I stop at Kim's garden.  I like everything here, but the Almond Chicken and Hot and Sour soup cannot be beat anywhere (and I have eaten at a lot of Chinese restaurants).  Do yourself a favor and try it.

data.title: Surprising Good Food
data.text: Visiting Novi, Michigan for golf show and took several of my friends to Kim's Gardens for dinner after a 10 hour golf show and altho not very fancy, the food was wonderful.  They provide you with large portions and very reasonable prices.  If you like Chinese, you can get anything at this place.  The egg roll was very good.  I had 2 Combo dinner with Fried Shrimp and Sweet/Sour Chicken with fried rice and cleaned my plate....

data.title: Good Dim Sum
data.text: Their specialty is  Canton food and Dim Sum is my favorite there. I have been tried other places for Dim Sum in this area and every time I have to go back to Kim's Gardens. Other dishes there are average and their service is average.

data.title: Bad food and bad service
data.text:
This is used to be my favorite  restaurant , but it deteriated over time, and my last time experience was so bad that I am not going to eat there any more.

Last time, when I was there with my husband for a dinner, we ordered two regular dishes we always order. One dish they cooked wrong, another dish took forever to come. When we pointed out the dish was wrong, the waitress took back , then put into another pot and gave to us as the new dish. The one took forever to come, when it came, it was not fully cooked! when they replaced with another dish, something in the dish tasted spoiled. 

I asked to speak to manager, the waitress said the manager was too busy to talk to us, and said she is the owner, we came to the wrong restaurant! She was so rude and seems we were there to make trouble. I knew she is a waitress there, not the owner, but I still talked to the manager and confirmed she is not the owner. With this kind of waitress, no wonder the service is so bad. However, one thing she is right, we came to the wrong resterauant! This is a restaurant care nothing about customer. We will never come to this restaurant again!

data.title: Nasty!
data.text:
My husband and I have been to Kim's in   the past it's not especially our favorite but  we were in the area and had a craving for some Chinese food. We were seated at our table and then I needed to use the restroom, that was a big mistake!  It smelled walking down the hallway to get to the restroom and then once inside the restroom it was absolutely disgusting. It should always raise a red flag in a restaurant that does not know how to keep their bathrooms clean and tidy!  
After that eye opener I was kind of afraid to order anything off the menu. There were only two other people in the restaurant at the time we got there yet it took quite a while for the waiter to finally come to our table and take our order. As far as the food goes we decided to just do three different appetizers which we never usually do at a Chinese restaurant but we weren't all that hungry after seeing the conditions of the bathrooms!  In all honesty we should've just walked out as the actual restaurant itself is very very dated and doesn't look clean either. And needless to say one of the appetizers we order was the panfried dumplings. I've had much better at TGIF!!  We will not be back.

data.title: Nice restaurant, good food!
data.text:
If you're in the mood for Sweet and Sour Chicken or General Chicken, this restaurant is a great place to go.
Dinners are served with soup, egg rolls, bread and an ample serving of the entrée.  
Both dinners were $12.50, also served with hot tea. 
Wait staff are friendly and aim to please. 
Christmas night is extremely busy, so be prepared to wait, weekends are also busy.

data.title: Nice Chinese Dim Sum place
data.text: The food was very good chinese dim sum.  You order by checking off items on an order sheet.  Food comes out quickly and the service was excellent.

data.title: Service is Great, Dish we got was bland
data.text: This is our second visit here, the first visit was not memorable enough to have us come back anytime soon.  When we were in a pinch late one weeknight, we knew we didn't have a bad experience last time so we decided to go ahead and order from there.  We both got the General Tso's Chicken.  The fried rice was decent, as was the egg roll.  Loved that they offered the dinner combination.  The sauce on the chicken was very bland.  We had to add some sweet chili sauce when we got home out of our own fridge and it tasted great after that!  We will probably not return again.

data.title: What happened?????
data.text: I used to drive for miles to eat here.  The portion sizes have shrunk and the prices have not. Food is still good but you now have to pay for a dinner roll???? I don;t recall having to do this at other restaurants. There is a new place down the road from me that gives you twice as much for the money and is good too.  I might save a trip and start going there.  Such a shame....:(

data.title: Amazing Chinese
data.text:
I like to eat and am willing to try anything. Asian food is the most underrated cuisine in the US, because everyone gets the same chicken fried rice all the time.

This place offered an amazing selection of usual and unusual dishes at a decent price, but the most important thing in the food it the TASTE. And trust me - it was something out of this world. We are here for two nights only and I do not know what to do. I want to order everything on the menu and ship it home in a cooler.

I am coming again.

data.title: Food and service are both amazing
data.text: I came here for Dim Sum with my husbands family last week and had an amazing time! Im originally from California so I don't know the area very well, but my mother in law brought me to Kim's Garden and it was absolutely delicious.

data.title: Very Dirty, Some food good some bad
data.text: Restaurant was not clean, food was splattered on all of the glass dividers between booths. The restrooms were disgusting.  Dinner roll was dried out. Tea pot was served with crud stuck all over the outside and inside. Egg rolls were all mushy inside, you really couldn't tell what was in them.  Sesame chicken was good but too spicy for my taste.  Shrimp with lobster sauce was the best I ever had and was a huge portion.  There wasn't enough rice for the portion. I got charged extra for more rice.  See below for picture of ladies room.

data.title: A favorite!
data.text: I have a rough track record with Asian food as its either REALLY good or REALLY not. This spot is consistently good and actually has other Asians eating there ( good sign!) Love the Almond chicken!

data.title: Dim sum experience was awesome.
data.text: I went there with a friend. This is certainly one of the best Dim sum around. Great food, great tea and fast service. We had more food that we anticipated and we loved it.

data.title: Good Chinese food
data.text:
we came for a family dinner. The food is quite good. 
Quite authentic Chinese food - the combination of the green onion, garlic, chili pepper, and sesame oil as spicy sauce is just right, a hometown taste.

data.title: Normal American Chinese to me
data.text: Stopped by Kim's with a few co-workers for lunch.  The wonton soup was good and the egg roll was excellent.  The Almond Chicken was fair, a lot of breading.  Service was fast and friendly.

data.title: Normally we don't try many Asian Restaurants in U.S.
data.text:
Fearing the American version of Chinese, we entered Kim's on a Saturday afternoon and found a good looking Dim Sum menu.  Shrimp with Spinach Dumplings, Udon Noodle soup, Stuffed Eggplant, Stuffed Green Pepper, Bean Curd wrap all had individual flavour accents, and great texture too with no detectable MSG. The bill was reasonable and the service was excellent.
My wife is particular and it makes me happy when she enjoys a good meal. The washrooms were clean and the staff worked well in a building that may have seen some better days but it was not run down.
